name: eccodes

conflicts.name: +openmp
conflicts.description: Cannot enable both POSIX threads and OMP

variants.name: netcdf
variants.description: Enable GRIB to NetCDF conversion tool

variants.name: aec
variants.description: Enable Adaptive Entropy Coding for decoding/encoding

variants.name: memfs
variants.description: Enable memory based access to definitions/samples

description:
ecCodes is a package developed by ECMWF for processing meteorological
data in GRIB (1/2), BUFR (3/4) and GTS header formats.

dependencies.name: cmake
dependencies.description:
A cross-platform, open-source build system. CMake is a family of tools
designed to build, test and package software.

dependencies.name: netcdf-c
dependencies.description:
NetCDF (network Common Data Form) is a set of software libraries and
machine-independent data formats that support the creation, access, and
sharing of array-oriented scientific data. This is the C distribution.

dependencies.name: openjpeg
dependencies.description:
OpenJPEG is an open-source JPEG 2000 codec written in C language. It has
been developed in order to promote the use of JPEG 2000, a still-image
compression standard from the Joint Photographic Experts Group (JPEG).
Since April 2015, it is officially recognized by ISO/IEC and ITU-T as a
JPEG 2000 Reference Software.

dependencies.name: libpng
dependencies.description: libpng is the official PNG reference library.

dependencies.name: libaec
dependencies.description:
Libaec provides fast lossless compression of 1 up to 32 bit wide signed
or unsigned integers (samples). It implements Golomb-Rice compression
method under the BSD license and includes a free drop-in replacement for
the SZIP library.

dependencies.name: py-numpy
dependencies.description:
NumPy is the fundamental package for scientific computing with Python.
It contains among other things: a powerful N-dimensional array object,
sophisticated (broadcasting) functions, tools for integrating C/C++ and
Fortran code, and useful linear algebra, Fourier transform, and random
number capabilities

dependent_to.name: cdo
dependent_to.description:
CDO is a collection of command line Operators to manipulate and analyse
Climate and NWP model Data.

dependent_to.name: magics
dependent_to.description:
Magics is the latest generation of the ECMWF's Meteorological plotting
software MAGICS. Although completely redesigned in C++, it is intended
to be as backwards-compatible as possible with the Fortran interface.

dependent_to.name: metkit
dependent_to.description:
Toolkit for manipulating and describing meteorological objects,
implementing the MARS language and associated processing and semantics.

dependent_to.name: py-eccodes
dependent_to.description: Python interface to the ecCodes GRIB and BUFR decoder/encoder.

dependent_to.name: libemos
dependent_to.description:
The Interpolation library (EMOSLIB) includes Interpolation software and
BUFR & CREX encoding/decoding routines.

dependent_to.name: fdb
dependent_to.description:
FDB (Fields DataBase) is a domain-specific object store developed at
ECMWF for storing, indexing and retrieving GRIB data.
